page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: {Brook House Farm - WINSFORD. {**************************** The farm,extending over approximately 150 hectares,is totally committed to dairy farming. Mr and Mrs Robinson assisted by their son Paul and two local employees are raising a herd of 260 Friesian dairy cattle which produce 2300 litres of milk per year. The milk is sold to Heal's Dairy and transported to Manchester each day for retail sale or conversion into dairy products. Mr.Robinson is conscious of the need to make the farm efficient and although dairy farmers in general have been affected by the E.E.C. quota system, he has been able to adjust to the changing circumstances successfully.The farm uses modern methods of feeding and milk production and is well equipped with up to date machinery.
